```
$ git checkout FETCH_HEAD 
$ test/lint/lint-spelling.sh

test/functional/wallet_multisig_descriptor_psbt.py:88: justs ==> just
^ Warning: codespell identified likely spelling errors. Any false positives? Add them to the list of ignored words in test/lint/lint-spelling.ignore-words.txt
```

and https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/22067#discussion_r744258501

events.body:
`src/util/syscall_sandbox.cpp:128: creat ==> create` -- could this warning be silenced by adjusting an ignored words list?

UPDATE: https://github.com/codespell-project/codespell/pull/2121

Probably, we should leave this warning until `codespell` update.

> `src/util/syscall_sandbox.cpp:128: creat ==> create` -- could this warning be silenced by adjusting an ignored words list?

`codespell --ignore-words-list creat`
